attributes.action: Give Funeral Directors Sirens to attend a death
attributes.additional_details:
Funeral Director's should be allowed blue lights and sirens fitted to their ambulances to attend to a death.

Families are having to wait several hours before the Funeral Director is able to attend if stuck in traffic, or roadworks.

A deceased being left after a certain amount of hours becomes a health hazard to people, such as the family, who are not qualified or trained to care for the deceased.

As well as the above, it is simply not very nice for the families to have to have their Loved One laying dead in their bed.
